Posts.Content: Hi maggiemee  Upfront I am not an expert - I just made the following decisions for me based on my research.   There is a lot of research being done on Fasting and Keto during cancer treatments.  There are also threads on cancer sites regarding this topic though not so many in the UK - a lot in Europe, Canada and US - so you could research outer countries and speak to people who have undertaken this approach - of course your oncologist would need to approve  - and like so many things with cancer it is a personal choice.  I finished radiotherapy last week and made the decision today not to go ahead with chemo as medium risk based on my oncotype report (so my decision) but I was planning to fast based on my research and my oncologist and nutritionist were in support of me fasting and I had been preparing my body.  Since being Diagnosed I fast for 18 hours between my last and first meals 5 days a week (I have been able to work and exercise daily throughout my treatment ) but again this is personal and based on research, and I have no sugar, white starchy carbs and I now focus fat and protein in my diet but I find this easy as I follow a Pescetarian diet and still have dairy/eggs - so full fasting would have been just another step...     Fasting does not have to be cutting out food completely - it can be intermittent, reducing calories like the 5/2 program -  I recommend you speak to your oncologist and ask to be referred to a dietitian if interested.... like anything there is a lot of information out there so it is overwhelming. I have no idea if my decision will help my future - but I feel great and healthy... and yes I will have a glass of wine or two.... I wish you well on your decision...   Jill xx
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and fasting

Posts.Content: Happy Sunday everyone.....   Congratulations Twinkle51...  Waking up Monday morning will be bliss as NO ZAPS.... what next for you? Fingers crossed for Tuesday  Jayg - I am definitely looking forward to something starting by the end of this week...  I dont think I will have a very happy face if delayed again ...  In the meantime... here is a photo of my Husband and I heading out for a sail yesterday in Qatar .. a bit of middle east (and blue sky) coming your way... Wishing everyone a lovely Sunday and a good week next week....  Jill xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Dreamthief  Where is this year going? then again there are moments I want it to go quicker. I shall be joining in April - I am still waiting for my oncotype test (I live in middle east and goes to US) so we are starting with radiotherapy first (and cross fingers no chemo needed)...   I get 'fitted' out this week and all going will start radiotherapy next Sunday.  Have been reading March posts but thought I would say hello to April. Lumpectomy 4 March - Grade 2 ER+ PE+ HER2- (lymph nodes clear)...   But this is NOT who I am... I am a lover of yoga who runs for fun... I sail the seas and ski mountains and am currently working in Qatar as is my fabulous husband - no snow here but lots of other activities, including sailing - until we hit 45+ degrees then we shade hop....  Following surgery - I went back to work and am back on the yoga mat and have had success jogging in the last week - definitely a jog... I have everything crossed I can continue - at least yoga which makes me smile. Like everyone - the unknown is scary and waiting is hard and at times patience and I are NOT friends. I support Macmillan so found my way here and everyone is helping me through my journey - even if it is by just reading other journeys.  Wishing you all a a lovely Easter Sunday and look forward (in a strange way) to our April journey.... and kicking the sh*t out of cancer.... swear words and I are BEST friends on this journey....   sending mindfulness and love.. with a touch of pi**edoff thrown in. xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Sortitoutkids and Gablegirl  Will be thinking of you both this week - let me know how first zap goes... looks like I will be a week behind you.... so will be reading your tips and here if you need to chat. Im with you Ange, I am keen to get started so we can get on with many tomorrows... especially as I am feeling like me again... I really wish us pink boobs only.... and no chemo results for me... oh and no long waiting time for therapy...   At the start of my journey my gorgeous girlfriends in Qatar had made for me this beautiful Mala - I am not sure if you can see the meaning of each stone, but it is with me every day - I figure I will take all the healing and the love sent my way... so I am passing it on and will dedicate my yoga practice to you both all week... I figure it cant hurt.. Jill xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Happy birthday Pam... Hope beyond the zap you are having a fabulous day... Room for cake? Ohhh I have small boobs too Sam so cross fingers I can do the same.. Though I am in frosty air-conditioning in middle east so may poke a few eyes out at work... Had my tattoos today so all fitted out ready to go..   they had to jab a few times as I have freckles so needed to distinguish the difference   they have confirmed I can start on 18th depending on Oncotype test results coming through on 17th Aloe in the fridge... Kiss to all on your daily zaps xxx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: HI Jackie Excellent - Sent an email to oncologist this morning. the more informed we are the better decisions WE can make..   this is my body and I want to look after it for a long time yet..  Funny enough, starting Tamoxifen is freaking me out the most.. I have stopped reading posts and will just see how I get on with it first.. Start following treatment. Hey Jan... Are you still doing long hours? I'm sorry your work is not as understanding..   Even working -They should be allowing you adjusted working hours as and when required.. Going to and from hospital every day is tiring and adding work on is a double banger..  So take care of yourself when you start tomorrow..  Im on day 4 and got tired by end of working day 3..   be thinking of you Tuesday... Everyone I hope the start of your zapping week goes well.. Sending love and positive vibes..  Recipe of the week. www.foodmatters.com/.../hazelnut-truffles Made these on weekend to get me through radiotherapy.. I don't have sugar so didn't need maple syrup with 85% dark chocolate (can also get sugar free).. I use crunchy hazelnut butter .. Seriously yummy full of good fats and for those trying less/zero sugar - a great treat...  Ferrero Rocher home style. With love.Jill xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Ange Sortitoutkids I took the 'young' comment and ran it - ha ha... I was 48 when found the lump but heading into 50 at the end of this year...  Did you have chemo? I have done a lot of research into food fasting 24 or 48 hours before chemo and the day of treatment.  Doctors here are all up for fasting benefits which is great... so am going to start preparing now  - up until this year I was following 5/2 days 500 calorie way of eating) so going to start again today... Still undecided on chemo but definitely listening to experts so need another conversation with them... I would be joining the June chemo group... How are you finding tamoxifen?  do you take at night?  We are on the same zaps days -  day 5 this morning (15/5 more to go)... little tired at end of day but I also figure that is because I start day at 6am and hit the couch at 8pm I completely agree with your comments - it seems we have taken a similar approach to cancer - I am head down getting on with it and administrating the hell out of cancer..  but I for one am taking a very long holiday at the end of  treatment hopefully in October..   My year has been horrid as my dad died suddenly from blood clot to heart on 9th January (very fit healthy man and he died on his actual birthday aged 76 - big shock) and having cancer has made it clear to me that I can spend my life doing other things... So my Husband and I are leaving Middle East Quarter 1 2020 and taking a year to travel back to London... Destination unknown at this stage...  I am going to do some living... ha ha I could definitely read your post this morning Alison PennyL.  I am so pleased you enjoyed yoga... I have been practicing for years and go on beautiful mindful yoga retreats every year.. be patient and give yourself lots of love in yoga as it is a life long journey of learning... I love that it is about me and my time on the mat... lately, I have days that the tears flow in Shavasana but  I walk out with a smile on my face... enjoy your journey... yell if you want to know anything. Let the tears flow I say.... Jan Jayg thinking of you today - sending much love and positive thoughts from across the ocean...  Love to all...  Jill xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Happy Monday everyone... sending positive zapping vibes with no side affect to all this week... I dont think I will ever get used to starting my working week on a Sunday....  joy of the Middle East...  Gablegirl - good luck with your first zap on Tuesday... cross fingers appointment takes place -  let us know how you get on on. Mumof3plusoh - Hey Sam - I wouldn't be surprised if you are also tired due to the round journey you need to take for your appointments.. how did your boob go over the weekend - still hot on the inside? did you have the Pancakes??? I am keeping myself distracted by lots of baking and eating - this weekend was Rye and Wholemeal Bread (3 attempts as no white flour) and yummy raw gingerbread cookies...  Two more weeks before Oncotype results so we delayed radiotherapy given the start day for radiotherapy and results were close together...  Im expecting a few good extra kilos by then.... even with healthy cooking all this waiting is a food distraction ha ha....  Jill Jill
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hey Ang  That is a bloody bummer....  (letting my feral Aussie side come out) The way we are going we will be in the May club....  BC has many opportunities for practicing patience.... though there are days when I want to tell patience where to go....  Working day nearly over here - and a sand storm has hit... no walking home today... love from across the desert... Jill
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Katiepie  Happy Thursday.... end of the working week here for us kids in the middle east - yippee.. Absolutely - here are a few of my favorite sites for recipes....  https://deliciouslyella.com http://rawfoodrecipes.com https://www.foodmatters.com https://www.nestandglow.com Some of the recipes are still high in sugar or carbs (banana, dates) so I tend to limit these in my diet as an extra yummy treat... but after researching got comfortable with maple syrup - though still a sugar I am basically rainbow vegetables and seafood... no sugar or white carbs (rice white flour pasta etc) meat or chicken... currently no booze either whilst on treatment - but given I am in the middle east that is not so tough....  My husband and I love cooking - we make yummy pancakes with coconut flour... cauliflower pizza.. cheesecake with cashews and frozen berries.... and feel fabulous at the same time... ha ha if anything can still over eat -  I love ginger biscuits - so tend to throw in extra ginger - like a lot....  let me know how you get on - we can share recipes  Jill x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: HI Sam Woohoo first zap day.. and so glad it went well - long may it continue...  Keep us posted... Thoughts are with you this afternoon.. And even better that you have lovely plans for weekend.. Getting out there amd living our lives to the fullest is a giant kick in cancers Butt... It is the weekend in Doha so I have been to yoga and making coconut flour pancakes with blueberries and home made coconut  yoghurt for friends for brunch.. Yummy.. And ten rounds of coffee... Maybe twenty.. Sending love and good thoughts to everyone JillX xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Good morning from sunny middle east.... Twinkle51 and Ginacarla - congratulations on your final zap.... If you were here I would give you a giant hug and take you out for cake (always room for cake)..  though I imagine it will feel strange for a while as cancer seems to take up such a big part of our brain. JoDec hopefully the Germolene cream works - how frustrating to get through treatment to have discomfort now. It is good to know that we should keep a stock of drugs for post zapping... Question - what are you laddies doing for deodorant? I was told not to wear and I can only imagine how much I am gong to smell in the middle east - eek....  Jayg how did you go yesterday for planning meeting?  I have a meeting at 2.30 today before my 4pm first zap - so I have my fingers crossed they have my oncotype test and that the results are low and I head into 4pm meeting with a smile on my face....   good thing today is full of meetings to help distract me before I go.... I also have my yog gear in the hope I can spend some time on the mat. I for one have found this week of waiting hard work...I feel like I want to open my brain and pull out the section labeled cancer...  Thinking good thoughts for you all as you start your day  Jill  xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Gablegirl - Sorry to hear that treatment is not starting as scheduled as these changes definitely play with your head and emotions. Whilst I am sure it is better to have our bodies ready - for me, the waiting and changes to treatment/schedules is the hardest part of this journey, often not knowing how to plan and move forward ... Im seeing the radiotherapist tomorrow for my initial consultation after being rescheduled from Sunday... ho hum...     Hi Mumof3plusoh  Welcome - and whilst  I wish we were not all here, it is so lovely to have wonderful people to share our frustrations fears and good days with....   My specialist said it takes a while for our bodies to recover following surgery and we have a lot going on in our heads so dont be surprised if you have days that your body says 'today is not a good day' I had one of those days on Monday - for what ever reason I struggled whereas I felt great the day before (and the day after) to the point that I definitely wobbled and felt 'off' and had tears in yoga class... so my solution was to go home and bake myself healthy cookies - and eat them watching Netflix...   I think we will redefine what normal is over this period  Jill x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Happy Thursday everyone... end of working week for me... yippee... Even with all the waiting and more waiting - I have had a good week as finally back doing inversions at yoga..  albeit with a wall behind me as falling over may not be good at this point ha ha.. I am prepared that my fitness and health may dip again - but boy has it been great feeling like my old self again. How is everyone else feeling?  Sortitoutkids - Good news regarding Letrizole... I must admit I am staying away from the forums on Hormone therapy until I start as found them a bit scary - and prefer to see how I feel first... but it is good to read some people are fine (im premenopausal). Gablegirl - let us know how you get on with appointment today... and everything crossed you can start radiotherapy next Tuesday... and also good news regarding Letrizole..  JanQ -  I still have fabulous blue nails - they match my blue boob... went for initial radiotherapy consultation yesterday and we did get dates in the diary 11th April for tattoo etc and 23rd April start radiotherapy as oncologist decided to push everything out as oncotype results back by 22nd April. lucky me - I now have two plans....  If oncotype low score I will start radiotherapy on 23rd April and if not will start chemo....everything crossed for a low score...  I figure I can spend this time focusing on fitness and health ready for which ever way the dice lands...   but I will be trailing behind you ladies and no doubt asking questions..  Hi jacks77 - welcome to April...  Jill xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Good luck today Sam - I hope the journey and the zap goes well.. will be thinking of you this afternoon for the next start of your journey... Talking of work - Im procrastinating so better get back to it.. Jill x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: morning lovely friends - happy Sunday to you all. I hope you are having a relaxing lovely weekend. Work day here in Qatar and zap number 3 for me.  20 and 5 boosters for me.  Hi Jan Jayg I am so pleased you have your first day scheduled on Tuesday.  No matter what we say you will be apprehensive - I certainly was and did not sleep well the night before... but like Ange says... close your eyes, breath and think of a lovely beach sipping cocktails... and no matter what you are on the  countdown clock versus waiting....  Overall I was very underwhelmed during treatment given my imagination.   I know we are all on a different journey - but I am still working full time following day 3 of 7am zaps and going to yoga.. long may it continue... but work are all for me just walking out the door if I need to go home or not come in... I am very lucky.   Similar to Sam, I am only using aloe vera gel - in the fridge so lovely and cold when you put it on. Qatar does not have the R1/R2 cream so I cant comment on this.... My armpit and lymph node scare feel a bit numb (this could be my imagination) - I am also only wearing camisoles versus a bra which is bliss.. Wow Bonnyjules - does your bed move? my bed stays still and the machine moves around me.... no wonder you have motion sickness.  jacks77  I was told by my radiotherapist that you may also feel nauseous as part of the side effects as the treatment does hit the top of your liver and I know from reading other comments woman do feel nauseous. They all suggested ginger tea and ginger biscuits.  PennyL I love yoga and practice daily - I found that being on the mat has helped me... and it sounds like you are on the right path for you... I have no idea how I will feel at the end of treatment - as you say we are so consumed with results, waiting and treatment we dont actually take time out to see how we feel.  I wish you well on giving yourself some healing and self-loving... I got my oncotype results back today (score 21... I am 49)  Will do some serious research as chemotherapy is my decision to make - swinging  towards no chemo... Oncologist has given me until post radiotherapy to make my decision as he says I am in treatment which is the important thing - it is difficult for friends and family to understand  how hard this decision is... I do not wish to look back to this point and think I wish I did... I need to live with this decision... and move forward with determination and no doubt.  So today I am feeling pissed-off with cancer... my brain has had enough   Oh and I am not using deodorant and funny enough I don't smell at all... not sure if it is due to radiotherapy...   Jill
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Jan Jayg  Cancelling a cruise is a bummer -  we have all cancelled a great deal for cancer - it has very rudely interrupted our lives.  Brain scan sounds serious? I certainly hope you can have that cruise in the summer - escape and enjoy.  Hi Ange Sortitoutkids  I love Singapore - nice and close to me in Qatar... My 50th is in October.  Woohoo on the Tamoxifen... just cuddle your husband when you have sweaty hot flush... share the experience... I have read a few posts on here where woman have come off hormone drugs due to side effects - and some have made the decision not to start based on research.  It would be a very difficult decision to make and I feel for them.  I'm going to cross my fingers and get on with it....  and hope for the best...  I have always been healthy but after much research have gone super charged and will continue to see if it also helps with Tamoxifen - basically Pescetarian Diet - but also no sugar (including high sugar fruit), white carbs (white flour, rice, pasta) or alcohol.. Has been easy shift  as mentally like you, it has been about preventing another incident and more research is being done on our diets - which I am advocate for.. I eat loads of yummy stuff and turn up to restaurants - so not changed how I live....just a bit more picky... though I am going to go back to red wine following treatment - good for your heart ha ha...  But I feel healthy and great.   I had the same thought process as you 25 and under = NO  which is why I am still talking to my oncologist... He has even gone as far as speaking to a European research expert and it was her recommendation...which he is in support of... maybe that is good enough - but will still ask my questions.  Like you said it needs to be a decision we can live with.  I will let you know know where I land. If I drink any more liquid a day I am going to burst... I also may be tired as I leave the house at 6.30am and get home at 8pm ha ha  Jill xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: HI Ange  No Oncotype results but we agreed to start zapping so like you I had my first zap today... I think at each stage we get apprehensive - It is crap... Im 20 + 5 boosters so the countdown has started... Woohoo... How did you get on? I have everything crossed for a smooth journey for us all... Oncologist Monday and I hope results are in then... Haha I feel like a broken record... My daily zappings are at 7am.. First appointment of the day then off to work..  Im lucky as only 20 min journey - I  hope your journey was nor too hirendous Sam... Jill xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Sam Mumof3plusoh  Tears are good for the soul... let them flow - we have bloody cancer and we have to live with this so you have every right to be angry.. sad... pissed off.. tearful, and have self doubt.  Cancer is bloody hard work and nobody knows how tough it really is or what it means to you, and the only way our friends and family know is to share how we feel with them.    Those of us with strong personalities (you would never believe I am one of them :-)...)  need to talk, cry, scream and share - those that love us will know we are still strong (probably bossy as well) fabulous and beautiful - but they may hold our hand more. I am so excited that today is your last radiotherapy session Sam - I know you still have a journey ahead of you, but this is such a significant milestone and you should feel however you bloody well want to feel... then eat cake  Sending you lots of love today... and hope the itching stops... Hi Katiepie  Some us will be going through radiotherapy into May so feel free to ask any question - this is your journey and one thing I have learnt; is we all have different experiences, but sharing helps.  I am only using Aloe Vera Gel twice a day (lovely and cold in the fridge) and baby wash (no chemicals) and I take baby wipes to work as I keep thinking I smell as I dont wear deodorant.  I have just had zap 6 and today my boob looks like it has been sun kissed.  I am still working and going to yoga (my first love beyond my husband) - but this is my journey and it is currently working for me.  How did you get on Jan? Jayg   Big kiss to you all... since I am at work I better get on with it... Jill
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: morning everyone. I dont think I will EVER get used to working Sunday to Thursday... Zap 8 today and BOY was it nice having a rest from the hospital over the weekend - especially as had a lovely spa day with the girls.  Aloe Vera gel seems to be still doing the trick for me - long may it continue... Was starting to get a bit itchy over weekend, but I slapped some Aloe on and it seems to ease the need... Jan Jayg How has the swelling gone over the weekend?  We should take time off work as needed to focus on our health, both mentally and physically. Cancer is one tough and tiring gig and whilst I am doing well and continue to rock up to work, I am taking a mental health day at the end of this week for a long weekend...I need a breather.  We come first. Gablegirl.  How are the raised spots going? cross fingers you get a date for your seroma this week... waiting is a constant and real pain in the bum with cancer...  Hi karebear and Nutmeg56 I have not started Tamoxifen as chemo has come back on the agenda.  I can say that Aloe Vera in the fridge is fabulous and is all that I am using.  I also use baby wash and baby wipes (no chemicals and dont use deodorant). I do shave though (cant remember who mentioned this).  I hope you are both doing well and recovering following chemo - I have been recommended (I am undecided) 4 cycles of TC which would start in June.... hmmm Enjoy your Sunday laddies... I hope you all have lovely plans and are doing well..  Hugs from the Middle East. Jill  xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Firstly gablegirl a big giant woohoo for finishing your radiotherapy... I am having a dance and a whoop whoop for you in my lounge in Qatar... My husband just rolling his eyes .. Let there be many more ciders in your future... I hope the draining of seroma eases your pain and only good things are coming your way.. Including watching your granddaughter win martial art competitions. With love Jill xxx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Not even 10.30 here and had morning call from oncologist My oncologist called and they are recommending chemo given my age, test etc.. Apparently I'm young as 2% under 50 I just made the age grade Oncologist spoke to spoke to a number of doctors after visit and a top research doctor yesterday who  suggests to have  4 cycles of Docetaxel and cyclophosphamide which considered less toxic. They are all now.ecommending given my age I do this treatment..  Bummer.. Will research..
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Congratulations Sam Mumof3plusoh - I am sure that wine went down very well... I hope there was a bottle next to it for refill :-) Today is a new and fabulous day....    Crap - I hope the swelling goes down Jan Jayg and that today is a better day.  Our bodies have their own mind on how they are going to react - it is a pity it doesn't listen to our heads.  Look after yourself.  Last day of working week here in Qatar Yippee... so I have done my 5 zaps for the week... 7 down, 13/5 to go...  Spa day with my girlfriends on weekend (dangle my feet in the pool and a facial for me).  Agree, sharing has helped me tremendously - I can see us all sitting around having a glass of wine as friends.... Have a good day everyone - Sam keep the celebrations rolling today... Jill
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Go have a fantastic holiday Treacle123 My oncologist gave me the big  thumbs up to go on holiday before chemo and just said look after myself.. . I even squeezed in a ski trip before my lumpectomy.. Also my Oncotype test took a while so I ended up  starting with radiotherapy on 18 April (finish 22 April) before chemo starting 10 June (holiday 1st June).. I have found that they will support your 'normal life' as much as possible as long as I'm still on a treatment path and looking after myself... Have a wonderful holiday with the girls.. Jill x
Posts.Title: can you put treatment on hold for a couple of weeks?

Posts.Content: Opps finish radiotherapy 22 May... Though would have been great only having 4 days worth Haha... Enjoy
Posts.Title: can you put treatment on hold for a couple of weeks?

Posts.Content: I am new to site - and new to BC... bugger.   Walking back to happiness definitely made me smile… I love exercise and it is a big part of my life.   As a breast awareness girl (fibrocystic right breast) I found my lump (left breast) at the end of 2017 but delayed seeing a specialist as my father passed away and I needed to go home to Australia and be with my family.. On 5 March I had lumpectomy and 5 lymph nodes removed and yesterday was upgraded to Stage 2 (lymph nodes and margin all clear – yay) PR+ ER+ HER2+ (Fish negative - yay) but still waiting on Oncotype Dx genomic test to ascertain if I need chemo given history.    It has been a sad and crap start to the year.   Cancer is definitely technical so have been reading all your wonderful posts and doing my own research. It does take some time to get your head around – and I wake up some days and think ‘what the hell’.  Actually most days.   Im an Aussie, but London is home (12 years) though currently working in Qatar Doha (Middle East) an work is amazing, hospital/care/treatment have been fabulous (and fast) but there is no online community and I support MacMillan foundation so  this is the community I would like to call home for a while.  My Husband is beautiful and my friends and family are beside me across the world – but already I can feel the benefit of joining a community that understands what my journey is really like.   I have learnt that patience and I need to become friends – so far we are not on speaking terms.    I went back to work following surgery and  got out into the fresh air for walks (currently not 45+ - though summer is coming) –  admittedly I was shocked by how tired I was and that my underarm and armpit felt like they were caught in a vice – and I did rest when I needed (Netflix became my friend) but for me being active and working (when I can) is the approach I am taking – and so far so good….   Yesterday I was signed off to go back to my first love – Yoga… and boy did this make me cry with happiness when I rolled out my mat in class and did a wonderful mindful class – stayed away from handstands as thought that may not be in the ‘moderate exercise’ list – my husband made me sit down and discuss ‘moderate’ with him before I left the house ha ha….   Anyway I am sure I will have lots of questions and will join others threads once I have treatment plan but wanted to say hi to an amazing group of people.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Purplemarriane  Like you I lurked for a while and have only started questions/comments.... I definitely had a 'f**k you to cancer party' with my husband and friends across the world... it became our chant - and still is....  We cant WAIT for the day we have the 'no more f**king cancer party'.  We all agree that swearing is very appropriate with cancer.... Explode away...  then do it twice for good measure and we will listen.  This is a very stressful time and it looks like we will be taking this journey together...   My dad (very fit man) sadly passed away suddenly from blood clot to heart in January (on his birthday which is just crazy) so I did not tell anyone (except my beautiful husband) as I went back to Australia to say my heartfelt farewells and be with my mum - it was the hardest secret I have ever kept.   I researched the hell out of breast cancer (my coping mechanism) and read the wise words from the brave woman on this community then started to write a daily diary of research, questions, feelings (both physical and mental) diet and exercise... it has helped me.... especially as the lives of others continued as they did the day before. My lumpectomy and lymph node surgery was 4 March 2018 Grade 2 PR+ ER+ HER2- still waiting on oncotype test for chemo but starting radiotherapy next two weeks as I live in Middle East so could take up to a month for oncotype results and my lovely oncologist wants me to get on with treatment in the hope chemo will not be required.   I call him lovely as he keeps calling me young (49).  I felt the same as you at the start of my journey but have found my voice and am now very open about cancer to my family friends and colleagues...   This is NOT the year I want - but it is the year I am having so I am having my moments.. This is your time to stand up and say this is about me - I know life continues around us but we are an important part of life   ... You take your journey and do what you need as we are all different... I love that we all stand up and say this is me and this is how I feel on this site. I found out pretty quickly who I love but are not that great at support and who are just fabulous - but overall you will find you are loved and as much as people may not always say the right thing, I do find they are coming from a good place.  This is certainly the case from me and lets be honest we all have our moments of saying the wrong thing in life. I have no other wise words (not sure they are even wise) as I am just starting out on this crap journey - but I  am at work and back on my yoga mat (which make me smile) and every day is a new day which I take as it comes... which includes telling my cancer to go f**k off and having a laugh with those that I love. I hope my bleeping does not offend anyone - I am a nice girl deep down... just not on cancer days. Jill xx
Posts.Title: I’ve been lurking.....

Posts.Content: Hi Pickles 18 It is a very personal decision and I know difficult to make.  For some people 1% means 100% so will opt for chemo. I was oncotype 21 and opted out of chemo with full support of my oncologist.  This year they published a research study on oncotype scoring and benefits of chemo for the intermediate group - this came out just in time to help my decision and my lovely oncologist spoke to specialists who also agreed with my decision.  There are lots of articles or you can read the study.  https://www.genomeweb.com/molecular-diagnostics/fewer-breast-cancer-patients-benefit-chemo-tailorx-study-oncotype-dx-finds#.W5DH4M4zZhE http://www.ascopost.com/News/58636 Hopefully this will assist in what I know is a difficult decision.  Jill
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx test unclear as what i should do next :(

Posts.Content: Hi Matohu The beauty is we are all different... Me... I worked full time and did yoga throughout my treatment - but when I finished radiotherapy (20/5 boosters) was when I felt fatigue -  I do believe some of this is pushing myself (stupidly at times) everyday for months on end and finally starting tamoxifen (we are not great friends - though getting better... I'm on day 50). I am still working full time and practicing yoga - and have just finished a wreck open water diving course - woohoo (was planned for January but then I was diagnosed) - but there are days I say just stop as a big brick wall has got in the way... usually around 3-4pm. I cant sleep away the fatigue as I cant seem to nap on weekends or sleep in and tamoxifen wakes me with hot flushes during the night - so I just sit and read or watch TV... I find even if I leave work an hour or two earlier than normal this helps when I am tired.   I get annoyed some days as I want the old full of energy person back - but Im trying to roll with it and deal with the new me knowing that my energy levels will return if im patient... as my husband has said - you have had cancer be kind and respect your body. I do believe being active helps - so I do something even if it is just 30 minutes as it often makes me feel better and less tired... but then just relax... especially on the weekends.  Good luck - Jill x
Posts.Title: Tiredness/fatigue

Posts.Content: Hi londongurl I cant comment about making the decision not to take tamoxifen  - but boy was I close... When I started I had a horrible time for the first 40 days whereas throughout my treatment I was fine (worked, exercise etc)   - so to suddenly feel nausea and tense every day if I took in the morning and not able to fall asleep and hot flushes if I took at night was too much - I didnt like the new zombie me and it ended in tears as was very emotional... I did my research and spoke to my oncologist and I now split my tablet and take half in the morning and half at night - and so far so good.  I no longer have any nausea or feel tense or emotional (within days)... I still have hot flushes and my sleep is disturbed because of the flushes but I can now fall asleep and go back to sleep, even with splitting the tablet hot flushes only come at night.. But I feel like me again - slightly tired version of me - though I think this is also about recovering from cancer...  Not providing 10 mg tablets is a pharmaceutical cost issue not a medical reason and lots of woman have fared better on splitting the 20 mg... for me I wanted to do everything I could in the hope that cancer does not return -  but I do know I would not have lived 10 years based on my first 30 days - so I spoke up and did my research.  and some woman have no issues with tamoxifen... so I say worth trying... try different times of day (morning then night) and if that doesnt work try splitting the tablet - speak up to your oncologist... Jill xx
Posts.Title: Refusing Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Morning I am on day 20 - but who is counting... me I have been working full time and doing vinyassa yoga throughout treatment (lumpectomy and radiotherapy - said no to chemo as oncotype score 21.  So active and upbeat...  I am on Nolvadex and not great. At this stage preserving (but not silently so oncologist work and home know what is going on).   If I take at night - I dont sleep and get hot flushes. If I take in the morning I have nausea, diarrhea and a headache and get punched in the face with fatigue and loose concentration - all day...  Im still working and going to yoga in the hope that my body is on a journey and I do find it better (especially emotionally) if I keep moving then sit still.    After doing a lot of research, My oncologist has agreed to let me split my tamoxifen tablet and try 10mg in morning and 10mg at night to see if I fare better (some woman have as not getting hit all at once and symptoms significantly reduced - or went away).  I started yesterday and I figure it may take a few days / weeks. There was research on reducing to 10 mg only but has not really progressed given so many priorities in cancer research.   It is another option as it is important we can live versus the side-effects taking away who we are - So dont stay silent. If I'm still rubbish we will try something different as my oncologist can see I am not myself. All the best - it sucks. Jill xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen brands UK list? trying to find one that suits me!

Posts.Content: Hi Julie XjulieX  It makes perfect sense Julie - I describe it as a tenseness that is inside my body that I never had before -  it is definitely better with splitting the tablet but it is still there... I think this may be the new me so trying to learn to relax and become friends...    I had 20 zaps and 5 boosters and skin was fine until zap 15 and then skin started to go blotchy and ichy but some lovely medicated cream from the hospital sorted that problem out and still use it today as makes skin nice and soft.... I feel like I have 15 year old skin again ha ha.... We all have our own experience with treatment so I wish you well in your zaps.... I found some fabulous buddies on this site who are now my friends and help me on my daily journey - we reach out when we are feeling off balanced and it helps  Jill xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Hi Julie  I agree 100% with Ange Sortitoutkids my lovely buddy...    I now split my tablet with full support of my oncologist and feel like my old self - with a few twists.  On the 20mg I could not sleep if I took at night and was a mess during the day with headaches, nausea and an internal stress ALL day...one day I lost it and thought I could not do this - but since splitting I have hot flushes which wake me up - but that is all I have (I am on day 40 of Tamoxifen - and also 4 weeks out of radiotherapy but who is counting).    Give yourself lots of love and rest as fatigue is a bit of a surprise even well after radiotherapy finishes - some days I am caught out as I do work and practice daily yoga and have done through out my treatment.. but there are days that I need to stop and sit as I feel like I have just walked into a giant brick wall - so those are my 'love me days' on the couch.  So do what you need to as your body will tell you what you need - even following treatment. Wishing you well through your treatment    Jill xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Good evening  I am currently on 8 of 20 with 5 boosters radiotherapy which is going very well but have now been recommended  4 rounds of docetaxel (Taxotere) and cyclophosphamide  - I believe TC. I will finish my radiotherapy first but would love to hear from someone who is or has been on TC...  Excuse me hijacking April as won't start until June but thought I would jump across from radiotherapy group.. Wishing you all a peaceful Sunday. Xxx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***
